keyMoments.title: Imprisoned at Tequila Wolf
keyMoments.description: Robin is held prisoner at the Tequila Wolf Prison Tower, wearing Seastone armlets that nullify her Devil Fruit powers while being interrogated by guards.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's dire circumstances after being separated from the crew and the harsh reality of the World Government's slave labor system.

keyMoments.title: Freed by the Revolutionary Army
keyMoments.description: Bunny Joe and the Revolutionary Army liberate Robin and all other slaves from Tequila Wolf, with Bunny Joe explaining they've been searching for her.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of Robin's connection to the Revolutionary Army and sets up her journey to learn about the true history during the timeskip.

relationships.description: Robin befriends Soran during her imprisonment at Tequila Wolf, showing compassion to the enslaved girl.

evolutionMoments.description: Soran visits Robin in prison to share sweets, demonstrating their bond.

relationships.description: Bunny Joe rescues Robin from Tequila Wolf and invites her to meet Dragon, establishing a connection between Robin and the Revolutionary Army.

evolutionMoments.description: Bunny Joe leads the Revolutionary Army in freeing Robin and invites her to their headquarters.

keyMoments.title: Chased by Man-Eating Plants
keyMoments.description: Usopp is shown being chased by dangerous man-eating plants including large walking sunflowers on Greenstone Island.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the dangerous environment Usopp must survive in after being separated from the crew.

keyMoments.title: Meets Heracles
keyMoments.description: Usopp meets Heracles, a beetle-armored warrior who offers to help him survive the island's dangers.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction to Heracles, who will become Usopp's mentor during the two-year timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Succumbs to Gluttony
keyMoments.description: Usopp becomes extremely overweight after overeating in the Forest of Gluttony, showing his lack of discipline.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's weakness and need for growth, setting up his character development during the timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Escapes by Eating Ramen
keyMoments.description: As the island tries to consume him, Usopp cleverly escapes by climbing up a ramen stream while eating it.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's resourcefulness and quick thinking under pressure despite his weakened state.

relationships.description: Heracles becomes Usopp's guide and mentor on the Boin Archipelago, helping him survive and later training him in Pop Greens.

evolutionMoments.description: Heracles introduces himself to Usopp and guides him to the Forest of Gluttony.

keyMoments.title: Soran Visits Robin
keyMoments.description: Soran, a young enslaved girl with blonde hair bearing slave number 3333, visits Robin in prison to share sweets with her.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Soran's compassionate character and her bond with Robin despite the harsh conditions at Tequila Wolf.

keyMoments.title: Freed by Revolutionary Army
keyMoments.description: Soran is freed along with Robin and all other slaves when the Revolutionary Army attacks Tequila Wolf.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Soran's liberation from a lifetime of slavery.

relationships.description: Soran befriends Robin during their time at Tequila Wolf, showing kindness by attempting to share food with her.

evolutionMoments.description: Soran visits Robin in the Prison Tower to share sweets.

reveals.information: Soran was born into slavery at Tequila Wolf and has spent her entire life as a forced laborer on the bridge construction project.
Despite being enslaved her whole life, Soran shows remarkable compassion and forgiveness.

keyMoments.title: Revolutionary Army Attacks Tequila Wolf
keyMoments.description: Bunny Joe leads the Revolutionary Army's assault on Tequila Wolf to free the enslaved workers.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Bunny Joe as a leader within the Revolutionary Army and demonstrates the organization's commitment to liberating slaves.

keyMoments.title: Frees Robin and Invites Her to Meet Dragon
keyMoments.description: Bunny Joe successfully liberates Robin and all slaves, then reveals the Revolutionary Army has been searching for her and invites her to meet Dragon at Baltigo.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Revolutionary Army's specific interest in Robin and sets up her journey during the timeskip.
keyMoments.quote: We've been searching for you. The Revolutionary Army would like to speak with you.

relationships.description: Bunny Joe rescues Robin from Tequila Wolf and serves as her escort to the Revolutionary Army headquarters.

evolutionMoments.description: Bunny Joe frees Robin and invites her to meet Monkey D. Dragon.

reveals.information: Bunny Joe is a member and leader within the Revolutionary Army tasked with liberation operations.
The Revolutionary Army has been actively searching for Nico Robin.

keyMoments.title: Heracles Introduces Himself to Usopp
keyMoments.description: Heracles, a warrior in beetle armor, appears before Usopp and introduces himself with his characteristic exclamation.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Heracles who will become Usopp's mentor, teaching him survival skills and Pop Green usage during the timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Guides Usopp to the Forest of Gluttony
keyMoments.description: Heracles leads Usopp to an area of the island where real food grows, showing him the Forest of Gluttony.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Heracles' knowledge of the island and his willingness to help Usopp, establishing their mentor-student dynamic.

relationships.description: Heracles becomes Usopp's mentor and guide on the Boin Archipelago, eventually training him in Pop Greens during the two-year timeskip.

evolutionMoments.description: Heracles introduces himself to Usopp and begins helping him navigate the dangerous island.

reveals.information: Heracles lives on the Boin Archipelago and has extensive knowledge of its dangerous ecosystem.
Heracles has a quirky speech pattern, adding 'n' to the end of sentences and people's names.
Heracles is a warrior, explorer, and botanist with knowledge of the island's unique plant life.
